Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 090072 PPM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 303 West 46th Street, LLC, Manhattan (C090072PPM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 93 Avenue B, CB 3, Application no. 20085198 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, Horus to construct, Manhattan (20085198TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Vacca:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 090070 PCX shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Landmark, 1200 Waters Place, Bronx (C090070PCX)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 090121 PPM  and shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. C 090120 ZMM.

Items.MatterName: ULURP, Battery Maritime Building, 10 South Street, Manhattan (20090121PPM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to conduct a pilot study to investigate the benefits and costs of providing bicycle access on certain express bus routes between Manhattan and the outer boroughs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to conduct a pilot study to investigate the benefits and costs of providing bicycle access on certain express bus routes between Manhattan and the outer boroughs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to create a public recycling program for newspapers, bottles and cans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Port Authority of NY and NJ to create a public recycling program for newspapers, bottles and cans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State to protect shoppers and store staff from dangerous shopping frenzies by mandating appropriate security measures and holding retailers accountable when people are injured.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Protect shoppers and store staff from dangerous shopping frenzies by mandating appropriate security measures and holding retailers accountable when people are injured.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Department of Citywide Administrative Services to offer a competitive exam for individuals serving in Emergency Medical Service positions within the New York City Fire Department in order to determine any promotion from Lieutenant to Chief.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: DCAS to offer a competitive exam for individuals serving in Emergency Medical Service positions within the FDNY in order to determine any promotion from Lieutenant to Chief.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Police Department to refrain from using tasers on the mentally ill and disabled.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD to refrain from using tasers on the mentally ill and disabled.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Police Department to expand enforcement efforts for private sanitation vehicles that drive, park, or idle on New York City sidewalks while loading garbage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: NYPD to expand enforcement efforts for private sanitation vehicles that drive, park, or idle on NYC sidewalks while loading garbage.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to divest its assets from financial institutions that evade New York State’s usury law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Community Development
Items.MatterName: NYC divest its assets from financial institutions that evade NYS’s usury law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Federal Government to institute a national usury law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: The Federal Government to institute a national usury law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President Barack Obama to revise the new Family Medial Leave Act (FMLA) regulations to be more employee friendly and to expand coverage to include companies that have less than 50 employees and for other purposes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: President Barack Obama to revise the new Family Medial Leave Act (FMLA) regulations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the powers of the fire commissioner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Powers of the fire commissioner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city fire code, in relation to emergency action plans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Emergency action plans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied with a photograph of the alleged violation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied with a photograph of the alleged violation.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the State to reclassify clean or processed dredged sediment from a “solid waste” to a “beneficial use” in order to increase its potential for beneficial reuse.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Urging the State to reclassify clean or processed dredged sediment from a “solid waste” to a “beneficial use” in order to increase its potential for beneficial reuse.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the unlawful damage or removal of trees within a Special Natural Area District.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Unlawful damage or removal of trees within a Special Natural Area District.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting requirements for the industrial and commercial abatement program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Reporting requirements for the industrial and commercial abatement program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to compliance of a participating candidate and his or her principal committee with New York City campaign finance regulations relating to the doing business requirements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Compliance of a participating candidate and his or her principal committee with New York City campaign finance regulations relating to the doing business requirements.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend the New York State Public Service Law in order to prevent the over-saturation of communities with electric generating facilities that rely on fossil fuels.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Public Service Law in order to prevent the over-saturation of communities with electric generating facilities that rely on fossil fuels.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int No. 880-A, 46-0-1


See files for individual votes.


Included in the General Order 47-0-0 vote is the override vote of Int No. 837 nothwithstanding the objection of the Mayor.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
